subject: Management
title: Timing Matters
description: A micro-lesson that makes Timing Matters usable.

hook.text: A manager saved feedback for the annual review. The employee said: why didn't you tell me in January?

buildup.text: Delayed feedback loses context, accuracy, and impact. Both sides forget the details.

discovery.text: Research: feedback is most effective when given within 24-72 hours of the observed behavior.

twist.text: Immediate doesn't mean impulsive. Wait until emotions cool, but don't wait until relevance dies.

climax.text: Feedback in real-time: quick, specific, low-stakes. Annual reviews should have zero surprises.

punchline.text: If it matters, say it now. Not in December.

quiz.question: When is feedback most effective?
options: Within 24-72 hours of the observed behavior
During annual performance reviews for proper documentation
At least one month later to allow emotions to settle fully
